flawed_nl_solution:
If each bulb uses 60 watts each day, the 40 bulbs that Allyn has uses 60*40 = <<60*40=24000>>24000 watts of power each day.
In June, with 30 days, the bulbs will use 30*24000 = <<30*24000=720000>>720000 watts of power.
If Allyn is charged an electricity bill of twenty cents per power watt used, in June she will pay 720000*$0.2 = $<<720000*0.2=144000>>144000

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 2400, not 24000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
